issue.title: [Python] Remove backward compatibility hacks from pyarrow.pandas_compat
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4830](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4830). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This code is growing less maintainable. I think we can remove these backwards compatibility hacks since there are released versions of pyarrow that can be used to read old metadata and "fix" Parquet files if need be

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4830?focusedCommentId=16932708) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
For this, I think we should ideally decide on which minimum version of pyarrow  we want to support (and then also test for this). Or at least we have something to communicate about like: "files written by pyarrow >= xx can be read"

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4830?focusedCommentId=17304314) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
`[~jorisvandenbossche]`  is there action to be taken here still, and if so, can this be done for 4.0?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4830?focusedCommentId=17307907) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
Yes, there is a clean-up that can be done, but I don't think it is critical for 4.0.0, so moving to 5.0.0

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4830?focusedCommentId=17565500) by @toddfarmer:*
This issue was last updated over 90 days ago, which may be an indication it is no longer being actively worked. To better reflect the current state, the issue is being unassigned. Please feel free to re-take assignment of the issue if it is being actively worked, or if you plan to start that work soon.
